qas.question: Who introduced new coinage in the year of 120 BC?
What coin replaced the ban liangs after only a year of distribution?
During what dynasty did the wuzhu stop being the standard coin?
What was the mass of the wuzhu coin?
What interrupted the use of the wuzhu coin during the reign of Wang Mang?

context: In 144 BC Emperor Jing abolished private minting in favor of central-government and commandery-level minting; he also introduced a new coin. <a0_0>Emperor Wu<a0_0/> introduced another in 120 BC, but a year later he abandoned the ban liangs entirely in favor of the <a1_0>wuzhu<a1_0/> (五銖) coin, weighing <a3_0>3.2 g<a3_0/> (0.11 oz). The wuzhu became China's standard coin until the <a2_0>Tang dynasty<a2_0/> (618–907 AD). Its use was interrupted briefly by <a4_0>several new currencies<a4_0/> introduced during Wang Mang's regime until it was reinstated in 40 AD by Emperor Guangwu.
